scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: In a series of letters and postcards, Algren writes to Targ re reading proofs of unpublished novels, his intention to write reviews, and the need to find someone who reads German to review the German copies of two unnamed books. Also include is a Christmas card, n.d.

did.unittitle: Nelson Algren to William Targ 1943 Jun 17

scopecontent.p: Writes about meeting Mr. Appel at a party given by Russell Goodrich from Appleton-Century, his impression of Appel, and his intention of doing a review for Appel.

did.unittitle: Nelson Algren to William Targ 1952 Feb 1

scopecontent.p: Mentions that the best book among the newly-arrived proofs of unpublished novels is a Harper book entitled The Awakeningby Jean-Baptiste Rossi, the latest nom de plumeof Vladimir Vassily Klecot, and thanks Targ for "The Witching Night."

did.unittitle: Nelson Algren to William Targ 1959 Feb 18

scopecontent.p: Notifies Targ of his new address and phone number.

did.unittitle: Nelson Algren to William Targ 1961 Oct 1

scopecontent.p: Algren suggests that he get someone who reads German to review the German copies of an unnamed book and to "send two to E. Germany andtwo to the West sothat, whoever makes out, posterity will not be deprived."

did.unittitle: Nelson Algren to [William Targ] n.d. Christmas

scopecontent.p: The Christmas card is inscribed "...and a couple hopes Nelson A."
